abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Project aims at
            assisting the Government in implementing its structural
            adjustment program by providing studies, expert advice and
            implementation assistance in key areas of the economy.
            Specifically, the project will finance approximately 300
            man-months of consultant services: (i) trade and pricing
            policies in the agricultural sector and strengthening of its
            institutions; (ii) effective protection in the industrial
            sector; (iii) financial, actuarial, administrative and
            managerial issues in the Social Security Agency; (iv) the
            Health System; (v) transport infrastructure in the Panama
            City-Colon corridor; and (vi) other currently unidentified
            studies needed to carry out the structural adjustment
            program. The complexity of the project requires efficient
            coordination both at the technical and administrative
            levels. Assisted by a panel of local and foreign economists,
            the Director of Economic and Social Planning in the Ministry
            of Planning and Economic Policy will be in charge of
            administrative and logistical coordination, including the
            appointment of counterpart staff in the technical agencies
            to work with the consultants. Arrangements are also being
            finalized with UNDP/OPE to act as contracting agent for the government.
